snippet: House Republicans staked out what they cast as a middle-ground option, pushing an approach that could include legalization but not a path to citizenship for illegal immigrants.
abstract: House Republicans put forward what they see as a middle-ground option in the debate over immigration, offering legal residency, but not a path to citizenship, for the country's 11 million illegal immigrants.

byline.contributor: Julia Preston contributed reporting from New York, and Jonathan Weisman from Washington.

lead_paragraph: House Republicans staked out what they cast as a middle-ground option, pushing an approach that could include legalization but not a path to citizenship for illegal immigrants.

headline.seo: House G.O.P. Open to Residency, not Citizenship for Illegal Immigrants
headline.main: House G.O.P. Open to Residency for Illegal Immigrants
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Open to Residency for Illegal Immigrants
